Q3.question: Let's start with your general view about the current direction of our country. Some people might think the country is going in the wrong direction. Others may feel it is going in the right direction. So let me ask YOU about the overall direction of the country: Would you say that the country is going in the wrong direction or going in the right direction?
Q3.description: Q3. Overall direction of the country

Q4A.question: In general, how would you describe: The present economic condition of this country?

Q4B.question: In general, how would you describe: Your own present living conditions?

Q5.question: How often, if ever, are people like you treated unfairly by the government based on your economic status, that is, how rich or poor you are?
Q5.description: Q5. Treated unfairly by government based on economic status.

Q6A.question: Looking back, how do you rate economic conditions in this country compared to twelve months ago?
Q6A.description: Q6a. Country's economic condition compared to 12 months ago

Q6B.question: Looking ahead, do you expect economic conditions in this country to be better or worse in twelve months' time?
Q6B.description: Q6b. Country's economic condition in 12 months' time

Q7A.question: Over the past year, how often, if ever, have you or anyone in your family gone without: Enough food to eat?
Q7A.description: Q7a. How often gone without food

Q7B.question: Over the past year, how often, if ever, have you or anyone in your family gone without: Enough clean water for home use?
Q7B.description: Q7b. How often gone without water

Q7C.question: Over the past year, how often, if ever, have you or anyone in your family gone without: Medicines or medical treatment?
Q7C.description: Q7c. How often gone without medical care

Q7D.question: Over the past year, how often, if ever, have you or anyone in your family gone without: Enough fuel to cook your food?
Q7D.description: Q7d. How often gone without cooking fuel

Q7E.question: Over the past year, how often, if ever, have you or anyone in your family gone without: A cash income?
Q7E.description: Q7e. How often gone without a cash income

Q8A.question: Over the past year, how often, if ever, have you or anyone in your family: Felt unsafe walking in your neighbourhood?
Q8A.description: Q8a. How often felt unsafe walking in neighbourhood

Q8B.question: Over the past year, how often, if ever, have you or anyone in your family: Feared crime in your own home?
Q8B.description: Q8b. How often feared crime in home

Q92A.question: Which of these things do you personally own? [If no, ask:] Does anyone else in your household own one: Radio?

values.1: Yes, someone else in household owns

Q92B.question: Which of these things do you personally own? [If no, ask:] Does anyone else in your household own one: Television?

values.1: Yes, someone else in household owns

Q92C.question: Which of these things do you personally own? [If no, ask:] Does anyone else in your household own one: Motor vehicle or motorcycle?
Q92C.description: Q92c. Own motor vehicle, car, or motorcycle

values.1: Yes, someone else in household owns

Q92D.question: Which of these things do you personally own? [If no, ask:] Does anyone else in your household own one: Computer?

values.1: Yes, someone else in household owns

Q92E.question: Which of these things do you personally own? [If no, ask:] Does anyone else in your household own one: Bank account?

values.1: Yes, someone else in household owns

Q92F.question: Which of these things do you personally own? [If no, ask:] Does anyone else in your household own one: Mobile phone?

values.1: Yes, someone else in household owns

Q92G.question: Does your phone have access to the internet?
Q92G.description: Q92g. Mobile phone access to internet

values.0: No, does not have internet access

Q92H.question: How often do you use: A mobile phone?
Q92H.description: Q92h. How often use a mobile phone

Q92I.question: How often do you use: The Internet?
Q92I.description: Q92i. How often use the internet

Q93A.question: What is your main source of water for household use?
Q93A.description: Q93a. Source of water for household use

values.2: Piped water into yard, plot or compound
values.11: Purchased from a cart with a small tank or drum
values.13: Surface water, like a river, dam, lake, pone, stream, canal or irrigation channel

Q93B.question: Do you have a toilet, water closet or latrine available for your use? [If yes] Is it inside your house, inside your compound, or outside your compound, or is there none available?
Q93B.description: Q93b. Location of toilet or latrine

Q94A.question: Do you have an electric connection to your home from the national power grid?
Q94A.description: Q94a. Electric connection from national power grid.

Q94B.question: How often is electricity actually available from this connection?

Q94C.question: Does your house use electric power from any source other than [the national power grid]?
Q94C.description: Q94c. Electricity available other than national power grid.

Q94D.question: What is the source of the electricity for this connection?
Q94D.description: Q94d. Source of electricity other than the national power grid.

Q94E.question: Is the electricity source owned by your household, or does it come from outside of your household?

values.3: Get power from sources both within and outside of household

Q95A.question: Do you have a job that pays a cash income? [If yes, ask] Is it full-time or part-time? [If no, ask:] Are you presently looking for a job?

Q95B.question: If you have paid employment, that is, regular employment for which you receive something like an hourly wage or a regular salary, are you required to pay an income tax, that is, a tax deducted from your wages by your employer?
Q95B.description: Q95b. Required to pay an income tax

values.0: No, am not required to pay

Q95C.question: What is your main occupation? [If unemployed, retired, or disabled, ask:] What was your last main occupation?

Q95COTHER.question: What is your main occupation? [If unemployed, retired, or disabled, ask:] What was your last main occupation?

Q95D.question: [If respondent has an occupation, i.e. responses on Q95B other than 0=Never had a job, 1=Student, 2= Housewife / Homemaker, ask:] Do you work for yourself, for someone else in the private sector or the non-governmental sector, or for government? [If respondent indicated in previous question that they were unemployed, retired or disabled, ask:] In your last job, did you work for yourself, for someone else in the private sector or the non-governmental sector, or for government?

values.3: Non-governmental organizations or civil society sector

Q96A.question: What is the main way that decisions are made about how to use any money that you have or earn, for example from a job, a business, selling things or other activities?
Q96A.description: Q96a. Who decides how money is used?

values.3: You make the decisions jointly with your spouse
values.4: You make the decisions jointly with other family members
values.5: Other family members make the decisions without you
values.6: None of the above/Some other response

Q96B.question: Who is the head of this household, that is, the person who has primary responsibility for making decisions on behalf of the household?

Q96C.question: If respondent is not the head of household, i.e. if the response to 96B was NOT 1=You [respondent] or 99=Don't know, ask:] What is the main occupation of the head of the household? [If unemployed, retired or disabled, ask:] What was his/her last main occupation?
Q96C.description: Q96c. Occupation of head of household

values.97: Not applicable (respondent is head of household)

Q97.question: What is your highest level of education?

values.4: Intermediate school or some secondary school/high school
